attributes.description: This map shows known algae-based biofuels producers. To claim your profile or add your organization to this map, please complete the survey at http://srce.mp/xnnnKt and your information will be updated on this map.
attributes.title: Algae Biofuels

attributes.description: 1. C02 to Fuels: harnessing photosynthetic algae in open system to produce fuels and chemicals. 2. Plant Biomass to Fuels: synthetic biology tools to develop new microbial solutions to convert lignocellulosic biomass into advanced fuels and chemicals 3.Coal to Fuels: discovering, culturing and optimizing microbes that can degrade coal and produce more value added products

attributes.description: Phycal is trying to harvest oil from algae without killing the algae. Instead, Phycal bathes the algae in solvents which can suck out the oil. Some strains of algae can go through the process four times or more.
attributes.title: Phycal

attributes.title: Petrosun

attributes.description: This process involves a catalytic hydroconversion of the mixture of diesel fractions and vegetable oil in an HDT reactor under controlled conditions of high temperature and hydrogen pressure. The triglycerides from the vegetable oil are transformed into linear hydrocarbon chains. Bio-kerosene produced using transesterification and a extra a proprietary process that results in a FAE with carbon chain size similar to the Jet Fuel
attributes.title: PETROBRAS

attributes.description: Algae microcrops thrive in a CO2 rich environment, using CO2 gas as a crop yield intensifier. After being fully grown, the algae is harvested and separated into three separate elements: a diesel distillate, biochar, and feedstock. The diesel distillate created by algae microcrops is a direct replacement for petroleum diesel.
attributes.address: 1901 S. Harbor City Blvd., Suite 300, Melbourne, FL 32901 USA
attributes.title: PetroAlgae

attributes.description: The company’s Quantum Fracturing technology combines with electromagnetism and pH modification to break down cell walls, thereby releasing the oil within these cells. Algae oil rises to the top for skimming and refining, while the remaining biomass settles to the bottom for further processing as fuel and other valuable products. This Quantum Fracturing technology uses micro-waves and ultrasounds.
attributes.address: 5645 West Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016
attributes.title: OriginOil

attributes.description: F-T - Carbo-V process

attributes.description: Patented vegetable oil refining process. Chemically, it entails direct catalytic hydrogenation of plant oil, which is triglyceride, into the corresponding alkane. The glycerol chain of the triglyceride is hydrogenated to the corresponding C3 alkane, propane — there is no glycerol sidestream. This process removes oxygen from the oil

attributes.description: F-T - First, the biomass (wood, straw, etc) is heated at 500 C in an anaerobic compartment. This is a pyrolization process that is able to produce a liquid component known as biosyncrude. Afterwards, the biosyncrude is vaporized at high temperatures (1400°C) to render a mix of carbon monoxide and hydrogen termed syngas. The syngas is then purified and converted to a variety of fuels including methanol, hydrogen and a synthetic liquid version of diesel (biodiesel).
attributes.title: Bioliq

attributes.description: Energy conversion of the CO2 using 3 items: solar energy, photosynthesis, electromagnetic field (which increases the algae growth rate) to obtain a biofuel comparable to fossil fuels. Development of a super-alga with a very high capacity of reproduction and energy production

attributes.description: Early in 2008, AlgaeLink had announced a photobioreactor system for algae made of UV protected transparent sheets rather than pre-manufactured tubes. The sheets are assembled on delivery into tubes, saving 90 % on shipping costs with this configuration. Later in the spring, the company announced a new process for extracting algae oil without using chemicals, drying or an oil press
attributes.title: Algae Link

attributes.description: Early in 2008, AlgaeLink had announced a photobioreactor system for algae made of UV protected transparent sheets rather than pre-manufactured tubes. attributes.description: A2BE’s system will use plastic bags 40 feet wide, 400 feet long and 12 inches thick. Motorized rollers clean the bags and agitate the water to mix the algae to make sure it receives adequate sunlight.    A2BE Carbon Capture is developing bio-secure, scalable, climate adaptive, and highly cost effective technology for producing valuable fuel and food from CO2 using algal photosynthesis and bio-harvesting
attributes.title: A2BE Carbon Capture
